tier.item: 12. Bíin tàal-ak ya'ab klàase nukuch nàasyon
fut come-subj many kind big nation
"(one day) many kinds of big nations will come
to sell in Chan Santa Cruz.
To begin with, it will be (is) expensive,
they must lower the price of what they sell,
to the point that it is simply given away.
First, it will be given away,
it is beginning with the free trade
there is a great friendship, like that"[FI.1]

Bíin tàal-ak ya'ab klàase nukuch nàasyon kon-o(l) te' Chan Sàanta Krus. Le ken chun-(u)k-e' ko'oj, , k-u-tàal ulak' nàasyon k-u-tàal ulak' nàasyon, yan-u-yèem-el u-toj-ol le ba'a k-u-ko'on-a, asta chen k-u-si'ib-al.. Bíin u-ketlan-muk'-o' T-u táan-il k-u-si'ib-al, k-u-ts'óok-ol-e, ba'atel kun-yúuch-u Be'orìitas, tun-chùun-u(l) yete(l) le libre~komèersyo-o' nojoch `àamistad yan bey-o'

(one day) many kinds of big nations will come to sell in Chan Santa Cruz. To begin with, it will be (is) expensive, another nation comes, another nation comes, they must lower the price of what they sell, to the point that it is simply given away. (One day) they will compete. First, it will be given away, after that, war will happen, right now, it is beginning with the free trade there is a great friendship, like that

from Belize before hab-A3-come money A3-say-pas-top quot fut come-subj prep-A3-time quot A3-two-friend-tr-tr.inc A3-refl person with dem Belizean-pl-dist according to dem history like dem write-part-abstr-top like write-part prep bible, prep bible prep write-part-abstr-dist dem Belizean-pl-dist A1pl-elder brother-A1pl fut come-subj prep-A3 day/time two-cl.time A3-unite-tr.inc A3-refl A3-unite-tr.inc A1pl-refl-A1pl with same Belize because dem-dist very A1pl-relative-A1pl exist-loc?-B1 like write-part-loc

From Belize, the money came before, it is said that (one day) the time will come when one will make friends again, with the Belizeans, according to [the] history, like what is written, (...) so it is written on the bìiblia, on the bìiblia, there it is written, the Belizeans are our elder brothers. (One day) the time will come again for them to unite, for us to unite with Belize itself because [that] we are really of the same family, so it is written.

tier.item: proves that the linguistic pattern found and presented in the next section of the paper is actually a form
characteristic of the original texts and not one which depends on the specific speech context of
remembering and quoting them. On the other hand, we cannot forget that these written texts were most
probably derived from the oral tradition.
Valentina Vapnarsky: The Voices of Prophecies: Expressions and Visions of Time in Yucatec Maya
way Noj Kaj Sàanta Krus X-Balamnaj
here big town Santa Cruz Balamnaj
"[That], me I say to you all,
(one day) you my engendered ts'úul will fight
with you my engendered Macehual souls
in the middle of the town of
Noj Kaj Santa Cruz K'ampok'olche' Kaj
to fight you again and again
but if it is here that it will begin
in Yucatán it will finish, he says,
but if it is in Yucatán that it will begin,
it is here that war will finish
here, in Noj Kaj Santa Cruz X-Balamnaj K'ampok'olche' ..." [YIX.16]
proves that the linguistic pattern found and presented in the next section of the paper is actually a form
characteristic of the original texts and not one which depends on the specific speech context of
remembering and quoting them. On the other hand, we cannot forget that these written texts were most
probably derived from the oral tradition.

dem-dist me say-tr.inc you(pl) neg person more me Juan de la Cruz only me fut fight-subj A1-born-nom ts'úul-pos con A1-born-nom soul-pos macehual-pos front-middle A3-town-pos fut-come-subj-B1 A1-born-nom ts'úul-B2pl A3-lie-B2pl fut come-subj A1 born-nom ts'úul-pos A3-two-two-fight you(pl) fur A3-start-pl one-cl.inan war neg indicated where fut return-subj dem war but if here fut.A3-begin-intr.inc-top atán fut.A3-go end-intr.inc quot but hyp Yucatán begin-top here fut.A3-end-intr.inc war here big town Santa Cruz Balamnaj K'ampok'olche'
proves that the linguistic pattern found and presented in the next section of the paper is actually a form
characteristic of the original texts and not one which depends on the specific speech context of
remembering and quoting them. On the other hand, we cannot forget that these written texts were most
probably derived from the oral tradition.
Valentina Vapnarsky: The Voices of Prophecies: Expressions and Visions of Time in Yucatec Maya

[That], me I say to you all, nobody else, me, Juan de la Cruz, only me, (one day) you my engendered ts'úul will fight with you my engendered Macehual souls in the middle of the town of Noj Kaj Santa Cruz K'ampok'olche'Kaj (one day) I will come, you my engendered ts'úul to deceive you (one day) they will come, my engendered ts'úul, to fight you again and again (...) (one day) they will start a war it is not indicated where will come back the war but if it is here that it will begin in Yucatán it will finish, he says, but if it is in Yucatán that it will begin, it is here that war will finish here, in Noj Kaj Santa Cruz X-Balamnaj K'ampok'olche' ...

tier.item: 29. ... pwes be'òora ten-e min-a'an in-fe' tin-tukl-ik
thus now me-top neg-part A1-faith dur.A1-think-tr.inc
pero wa dyòos u-k'at-e, ma' xan-i',
but hyp god A3-want-top, neg also-neg
pero ma' jach k-k-ojel ba'ax tyèempo-il-i' (...)
but neg very hab-A1pl-know what time-abstr-neg
"... So, now, I don't have my faith I think,
because, true, we are really in freedom,
but, if God wants, it may be,
The particle ma' is the common form of negation in Yucatec Maya. It can either be used with a
verb or a lexical phrase, or alone (just to say "no"). Ma' usually precedes modal or aspectual prefixes; but
some aspectual prefixes (like k-) cannot appear with it, and in this case ma' directly precedes the ergative
For the completive "never" (something that has never happened, but not that will never happen),
the form mix jun tèen/ mix jum p'ùul ("nor one time") is used.
28 / Institut für Ethnologie der Universität Bern: Arbeitsblätter Nr. 14, 1996
I say that there won't be any revolt soon,
maybe (it is sure that it will happen) one day,
but we don't know really in what time".[TI.1]
29. ... pwes be'òora ten-e min-a'an in-fe' tin-tukl-ik

but neg very hab-A1pl-know what time-abstr-neg
"... So, now, I don't have my faith I think,
because, true, we are really in freedom,
but, if God wants, it may be,
The particle ma' is the common form of negation in Yucatec Maya. It can either be used with a
verb or a lexical phrase, or alone (just to say "no"). Ma' usually precedes modal or aspectual prefixes; but
some aspectual prefixes (like k-) cannot appear with it, and in this case ma' directly precedes the ergative
For the completive "never" (something that has never happened, but not that will never happen),
the form mix jun tèen/ mix jum p'ùul ("nor one time") is used.
28 / Institut für Ethnologie der Universität Bern: Arbeitsblätter Nr. 14, 1996
I say that there won't be any revolt soon,
maybe (it is sure that it will happen) one day,
but we don't know really in what time".[TI.1]

... pwes be'òora ten-e min-a'an in-fe' tin-tukl-ik tumen jach làaj lìibertad yan-il-o'on lo'oba, pero wa dyòos u-k'at-e, ma' xan-i', pero jach de pròonto be'orìitas inw-a(`al-i)k-e ma' u-jan-yan-ta rebwèeltas, tal bes bíin, pero ma' jach k-k-ojel ba'ax tyèempo-il-i' (...)

thus now me-top neg-part A1-faith dur.A1-think-tr.inc because very totally freedom exist-loc-B2pl really but hyp god A3-want-top, neg also-neg but very soon right now A1-say-tr.inc-top neg A3-fast-exist-intr.inc revolts maybe fut but neg very hab-A1pl-know what time-abstr-neg

... So, now, I don't have my faith I think, because, true, we are really in freedom, but, if God wants, it may be, but not very soon, right now, I say that there won't be any revolt soon, maybe (it is sure that it will happen) one day, but we don't know really in what time".
The particle ma' is the common form of negation in Yucatec Maya. It can either be used with a
verb or a lexical phrase, or alone (just to say "no"). Ma' usually precedes modal or aspectual prefixes; but
some aspectual prefixes (like k-) cannot appear with it, and in this case ma' directly precedes the ergative
For the completive "never" (something that has never happened, but not that will never happen),
the form mix jun tèen/ mix jum p'ùul ("nor one time") is used.
28 / Institut für Ethnologie der Universität Bern: Arbeitsblätter Nr. 14, 1996

"le nukuch máak-o mix ba'a k-u-bèet-ik fàalta ti', tulàaka yan ti'-o' ba'al u-jàan-t-o', ba'al uy-uk'-o', tuláaka mix jun-téen k-u-bèet-ik fàalta ti' pero mix jun-téen k-u-to'ok-o xan ti'-o, le je'el-o' pwèes tal bes xàan-e', kòomo jach u-kre'er-m-oob-o', k-u-yáant-al-o xan tumen dyòos, pero le je'el-o', to'on-e ma' tan-k-mèet-ik, bíin wale',

dem big person-pl neg thing hab-A3-do-tr.inc need prep all exist prep-pl thing A3-eat-tr-pl thing A3-drink-pl all neg one-cl.time(s) hab-A3-do-tr.inc need prep but neg one-cl.time hab-A3-take away-pl also prep-pl dem dem-dist thus maybe also-top as very A3-believe-perf-pl-dist hab-A3-help-pas-pl also by god but dem dem-dist we-top neg dur-A1pl-do-tr.inc, fut maybe

The big people (ancients) they need(ed) nothing, they have (had) everything, things to eat things to drink, everything, they never need(ed) anything, but no-one ever takes (took) anything from them that, it may be also, because they believed a lot, they were helped by God, but that, we are not doing it, maybe (one day) (it is said that it is sure) we will ...

"... It is said then that when Ki'ichkelem Yùum came,
now there is going to be freedom,
you are going to use gold,
you are going to use smooth clothes,
you are going to travel on the air,
you are going to eat good food,
nobody now will go to do his service"18
(one day) maybe it will happen again,
(one day) you will be called to account again,
but that, nobody knows who will do it,
[thus,] the great people know how will come the truth" [CVI.12]

...Kaj tun bin j-máan ki'ichkelem yùume, kaj (t-uy-)a'al-a ti'-o: "Ja'libe' tata-e'ex be'orìita libre-e'ex be'òora mi ka(`a)j yàan-taj lìibertad mi ka(`a)j usàar-t-e'ex òoro mi ka(`a)j usàar-t-e'ex le o'olki nòok'-o'-o mi ka(`a)j-e'ex màan ti yòol íik' mi ka(`a)j-e'ex jàan-t-e'ex ma'alo' jan-(a)l-o' be'òora ts'o'ok-i mix máak bejl-ak kun-bin u-bèet u-tùus-il~u-bèel" kaj tun a'al-a' ti leti'-òob-e': "Be'òora tuláaka ts'o'ok-a'an bíin wa úuch-uk tuka'atene' pero ma' séeb-i bíin ch'a'ak u-pach kwèenta tukatèen ti tech pero le-lo' mix máak yojel máax le nukuch máak-o' tun (u)y-òojlo' bix kun-jàaj-ta(l)

then thus quot com-travel beautiful father-top, then (com-A3-)say-tr.comp prep-pl no matters father-B2pl right now free-B2pl now fut.inm exist-intr.inc freedom fut.inm use-tr-B2pl gold fut.inm use-tr-B2pl dem smooth cloth-pl-dist fut.inm-B2pl travel prep on air fut.inm-B2pl eat-tr-B2pl good eat-intr.inc-dist now end-B3 neg person now fut.A3-go A3-do A3-lie?-pos~A3-way [tùus~bèel=(to) serve]] then thus say-pas 3pron-pl-top now all end-part fut hyp occur-subj again but neg fast-neg fut call to account again prep you but dem-dist neg person know who dem big person-pl then A3-know-pl how fut.A3-truth-intr.inc...."
34 / Institut für Ethnologie der Universität Bern: Arbeitsblätter Nr. 14, 1996

... It is said then that when Ki'ichkelem Yùum came, he told them: no matter, fathers, right now you are free, now there is going to be freedom, you are going to use gold, you are going to use smooth clothes, you are going to travel on the air, you are going to eat good food, now, it is finished, nobody now will go to do his service"18 And then they were told: "Now everything is finished (one day) maybe it will happen again, but not soon, (one day) you will be called to account again, but that, nobody knows who will do it, [thus,] the great people know how will come the truth
